newsitem.title: USA: Los Angeles has funds for Twin Towers - official.
newsitem.headline: Los Angeles has funds for Twin Towers - official.

text.p: Los Angeles County's chief administrative officer said on Monday that he has identified the funds to open the giant Twin Towers Correctional facility.
The facility was completed in 1995 but has remained closed for lack of operating funds.
Chief Admistrative Officer David Janssen told reporters at a briefing on Monday that he would not discuss the source of the funds until later this week.

To help open the Twin Towers, county officials had said funds would be shifted from other facilities. The proposal would result in about $14 million in additional county costs in fiscal year 1996-1997. The net county cost in fiscal year 1997-1998 would be about $16 million.
